column4: wy can't i get an identd response? oidentd is installed anr running, port 113 is forwarded and open in firestarter, what  is missing?
try 'telnet localhost 113' see what happens.
it connected
in that case it must have something to do with your router setup, do you have access to an outside linux box. to try the same thing - just to be sure?
:- nope, only windows
well you can try it from a windows machine too.. in any case im pretty sure it has to do with your router setup. you have to restart some router to enable forwarding changes - just a guess.
:- what i dont get is that it was working fine a couple of days ago
:- ill check my router, restart a couple of times and c from there, thx
well there are a few things to know. mostly identd is started over inetd which honors the /etc/hosts.allow and hosts.deny file - if you made any changes there that might be it.
also you might have gotten a different ip by your dhcp (usually build in your router) so the forwarding donst work anymore. (ifconfig - to check)
:- i think the problem started since i followed an howto to get virtualbox to get an ip from my router, it told me to setup a br0 and a tap0
do you still use those network devices?
so you linuxbox has more than one ip assigned to it?
:- i dont think so. lets c. br0=192.168.2.100 tap0=192.168.2.5 eth0 has noip, but my router gives my pc .100 and the virtual machine .102
are you using a windows vb host?
:- im using a windows server 2003 with virtualbox
:- yes windows vb
well if all the other network stuff on ubuntu works im not really sure what else it could be.. i never really used anything windows host based.
:- could it have to with the ip on br0 and tap0 being dif?
are you sure its not the windows host system that blocks the incoming connections in the first place?
:- but im using xchat on ubuntu not windows
:- sorry
well im a bit confused here you said your virtual system is supposed to get the ip .102 but you say it has got .100 - what is the ip your windows system has?
